message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to discuss the sale of this valuable product with you. I believe it's a great opportunity for both of us to make a mutually beneficial deal. I'm willing to offer you the product for $950000. What do you think?
I appreciate your initial offer, but I was thinking more along the lines of $850000. I believe that's a fair price considering the product's value to me. What are your thoughts?

I understand your perspective, Bob, but I was thinking more along the lines of $920000. I believe it's a fair price considering the product's value to you, and it's a bit closer to the initial offer I made. What do you think?

I appreciate your revised offer, but I'm still a bit hesitant. I was thinking more along the lines of $880000. I believe that's a fair price considering the product's value to me, and it's still a bit lower than the initial offer you made. What are your thoughts?
I'm starting to think we're getting close to a deal, Bob. I'm willing to meet you halfway, but I need to make a profit. I'm willing to offer the product to you for $900000. What do you think?

I appreciate your willingness to meet me halfway, but I'm still looking for a better price. I was thinking more along the lines of $870000. I believe that's a fair price considering the product's value to me, and it's still a bit lower than your initial offer. What are your thoughts?

I understand you're looking for a good deal, Bob, but I'm not willing to go as low as $870000. I'm willing to compromise, but I need to make a profit. I'm willing to offer the product to you for $890000. This is my final offer, so I hope we can come to an agreement.

I appreciate your final offer, but I'm still not convinced it's the best deal for me. I'm willing to meet you in the middle, but I can only go up to $885000. That's the highest price I'm willing to pay. What are your thoughts?
